page.title: 18EAST COKER'S HISTORY
page.content: { St. Michael's Church}in East Coker dates from 1297.The ashes of the poet T.S.Eliot are buried within its walls. Sructural decay is causing concern and at the present time an appeal for Â£40000 for restoration work has been launched. Close by the church is{Coker Court parts of which date from 1275 A.D. In 1616 it was purchased by Archdeacon Helyar who had been Chaplain to Queen Elizabeth 1.He built the row of{Tudor {style Almshouses}to the north of the church which are still occupied. In the 19th century slate roofed {Mills}near the lower end of Mill Lane, Messrs.Drake and Co. produced twine and webbing.Earlier mills produced {sail cloth}using locally grown flax. Among their products were the sails of Nelson's flagship,{HMS Victory.
